main event: A report of an unidentified flying object observed near Griffiss AFB in New York on December 3, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for a duration of 5 minutes., The object appeared to have length and was white or yellowish in color., The object did not exhibit high speed or rapid maneuvering., The object moved westward and did not match the brightness or flight characteristics of known satellites or aircraft., The report suggested that it might have been mistaken for a satellite but ruled out Sputnik due to its observed characteristics.
witness description: The witness observed the object while driving on the New York Thruway.
